content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 31 Oct 2018How do we get the historical value (e.g. past 5 years NAV) of a REIT?When valuing a REIT, there are some ratios that we need to look at.. e.g. the NAV, gearing ratio, gross revenue etc. How do you guys extract those values (past 5 years NAV value)? Do you guys manually browse through all the past financial results and extract them individually, then plug into excel and plot the charts? Just wondering if there could be an overview section/place where we can view the data for past years at a glance etc.Reference: http://www.crct.com.sg/irfinancialresult.html2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Dwivid SharmaLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 19 Nov 2018Hi there,There are n numbers of websites which are providing valuable details about REIT's. Here are somehttp://www.shareinvestor.com/sghttps://www.investingnote.com/ And here is the list of REIT's that you can consider for investigate for investment.https://www.mmfsolutions.sg/blog/top-singapore-real-estate-investment-trust-reits-2018/and here are some undervalued REIT's and stocks that you would like to invest.https://www.mmfsolutions.sg/blog/singapore-undervalued-stocks-reits/0 comments0

Loh Tat TianLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 19 Nov 2018https://www2.sgx.com/securities/stock-screener?page=2&code=CY6U&lang=en-usThis is an example of getting the financials.You just use the net asset value (by total assets - total liablility) to divide by the number of total equity.0 comments0
